docs.abstract: On the eve of her next album, the singer has hybridized her many talents — music, dance, activism, aesthetics — to inspire a new model for the modern pop artist.
docs.snippet: On the eve of her next album, the singer has hybridized her many talents — music, dance, activism, aesthetics — to inspire a new model for the modern pop artist.
docs.lead_paragraph: A MONONYM IS possessed of a certain celebrity: Prince, Madonna, Iman. No surname needed, thank you very much. Just a couple of syllables and the whole of the mononym’s grandeur flashes across our consciousness.

docs.abstract: Two members have been arrested. Gavin McInnes, the group’s founder, said other members would soon be in custody.
docs.snippet: Two members have been arrested. Gavin McInnes, the group’s founder, said other members would soon be in custody.
docs.lead_paragraph: The founder of the far-right group the Proud Boys said on Friday that he was arranging the surrender of several members whom the police are seeking in connection with a violent brawl outside a Republican club in Manhattan last weekend.

headline.main: Founder of Proud Boys Says He’s Arranging Surrender of Men in Brawl
headline.print_headline: Founder of Proud Boys Says He Is Arranging Surrender of Men in Brawl

byline.original: By Alan Feuer and Ali Winston

docs.abstract: The Black Lives Matter movement and the abuses and policy decisions it has highlighted have become an integral part of races that will decide control of Congress in November.
docs.snippet: The Black Lives Matter movement and the abuses and policy decisions it has highlighted have become an integral part of races that will decide control of Congress in November.
docs.lead_paragraph: ALPHARETTA, Ga. — An air of solemnity hangs over Lucy McBath’s bid for Congress.

headline.main: ‘Democrat. Fighter. Mother.’ Lucy McBath Is Redefining Social Justice in Politics.
headline.print_headline: On Campaign Trail, Mothering a Legacy

docs.abstract: A work by the British painter Jenny Saville sold for $12.4 million, an auction high for a living female artist. But Banksy’s prank grabbed the headlines.
docs.snippet: A work by the British painter Jenny Saville sold for $12.4 million, an auction high for a living female artist. But Banksy’s prank grabbed the headlines.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — She should have been the center of attention, but somehow everyone got distracted.

headline.main: A Landmark Achievement for a Painting by a Woman, Upstaged by a Man

docs.abstract: The New York Times and ProPublica examined the Charlottesville, Va., school system, which has one of the biggest racial gaps in the country.
docs.snippet: The New York Times and ProPublica examined the Charlottesville, Va., school system, which has one of the biggest racial gaps in the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. — This article was reported and written in a collaboration with ProPublica, the nonprofit investigative journalism organization.

headline.main: ‘You Are Still Black’: Charlottesville’s Racial Divide Hinders Students
headline.print_headline: Separated, and Far From Equal, in Charlottesville’s Racial Divide

byline.original: By Erica L. Green and Annie Waldman

docs.abstract: Donja R. Love’s fantasia on the married life of a great civil rights orator suggests the price paid by the woman who gives him his voice.
docs.snippet: Donja R. Love’s fantasia on the married life of a great civil rights orator suggests the price paid by the woman who gives him his voice.
docs.lead_paragraph: Like Lincoln, and for similar reasons, the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. has become more than an actual historical human: He’s a cultural touchstone. We are used to seeing that civil rights leader, or his pseudonymous stand-ins, fictionalized and anatomized in plays like “The Mountaintop” by Katori Hall, “The Good Negro” by Tracey Scott Wilson and “The Man in Room 306” by Craig Alan Edwards.

headline.main: Review: In ‘Fireflies,’ the Preacher’s Wife Gets Her Say
headline.print_headline: Behind the Pulpit, a Preacher’s Wife Gets Her Say

docs.abstract: During three seasons, Borders has overseen a surge in attendance and TV ratings, and the league’s shift to having a stronger imprint in liberal social causes.
docs.snippet: During three seasons, Borders has overseen a surge in attendance and TV ratings, and the league’s shift to having a stronger imprint in liberal social causes.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the W.N.B.A. on the cusp of union negotiations that could radically reshape its finances for years to come, the league’s president, Lisa Borders, is stepping down after three seasons to become the first chief executive and president of Time’s Up, an advocacy group for women in the workplace.

headline.main: W.N.B.A. President Lisa Borders Steps Down for Time’s Up
headline.print_headline: W.N.B.A. Boss Leaves for Advocacy Group

headline.main: 8 Things to Do With Your Kids in N.Y.C. This Weekend

docs.abstract: From “Black Panther” to “The Hate U Give,” new movies about the fight for black lives deliver powerful fantasies. But can they be truthful?
docs.snippet: From “Black Panther” to “The Hate U Give,” new movies about the fight for black lives deliver powerful fantasies. But can they be truthful?
docs.lead_paragraph: There never was an Officer Andy Landers, but, as conceived by Spike Lee, he’s crudely functional, a villain with a destiny as awful as it is seductive. In “BlacKkKlansman,” Lee’s summer hit based loosely on the true story of Ron Stallworth, a black police officer who infiltrated the Ku Klux Klan in Colorado in the 1970s, Landers is the cretin within, an unreformed racist among Stallworth’s own ranks.

headline.main: The Unreality of Racial Justice Cinema
